meanings.definition: To refuse or neglect to oblige; to fail to do a favor or service for
meanings.sent1: I didn't want to disoblige my friend, so I helped them with their homework.
meanings.sent2: Please don't disoblige your neighbor by ignoring their request for help.
meanings.sent3: It would disoblige the cat if you forgot to fill its food bowl.
meanings.sent4: Her absence seemed to disoblige the room, leaving it empty and quiet.
meanings.sent5: The decision to disoblige the customer resulted in a lost opportunity for the business.

meanings.definition: To offend or displease by failing to fulfill a request or expectation
meanings.sent1: He didn't mean to disoblige his teacher by forgetting to turn in the assignment.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant risked to disoblige its customers by running out of their favorite dish.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up with the reservation seemed to disoblige the hostess, but she handled it gracefully.
meanings.sent4: Her constant lateness began to disoblige her friends, causing tension in the group.
meanings.sent5: The failure to deliver on time would disoblige the client and harm the company's reputation.
